item.title: U.S. Support for Syria Peace Plans Demonstrates Shift in Priorities
item.description: American support for two diplomatic initiatives in Syria underscores the West’s quiet retreat from its demand that Bashar al-Assad step down immediately.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By ANNE BARNARD and SOMINI SENGUPTA

item.title: Prosecutor in Argentina Bombing Inquiry Is Found Dead
item.description: The death of the prosecutor, Alberto Nisman, came as he was about to testify to lawmakers about his findings in the 1994 bombing of a Jewish center.
item.dc:creator: By JONATHAN GILBERT

item.title: Iran Says Israeli Strike in Syria Killed One of Its Generals
item.description: The Israeli airstrike, which also killed several Hezbollah fighters over the weekend, compounded the tension and unpredictability in the region.
item.dc:creator: By ANNE BARNARD

item.title: Clashes Between Yemeni Forces and Houthis Break Out in Capital
item.description: Yemen’s leadership was under serious threat as government troops clashed with the militiamen around the presidential palace and other parts of the capital.
item.dc:creator: By SHUAIB ALMOSAWA and KAREEM FAHIM
item.media:description: Houthi fighters taking position during clashes near the presidential palace in Sana, Yemen, on Monday.

item.title: Prominent North Korean Defector Recants Parts of His Story of Captivity
item.description: Shin Dong-hyuk became famous after speaking about his childhood in a prison camp. On Sunday, he said that elements of his harrowing tale were untrue.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By CHOE SANG-HUN
item.media:description: Shin Dong-hyuk, far right, testified in a hearing in August 2013 about his escape from a North Korean prison camp in 2005.

item.title: European Leaders Discuss Beefed-Up Security in Wake of Attacks
item.description: The foreign ministers’ meeting in Brussels will add to pressure to establish a European system for exchanging passenger information.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW HIGGINS

item.title: Chinese Civilians Said to Be Trapped by Fighting in Myanmar
item.description: State news organizations reported that hundreds of Chinese were unable to leave the country’s northeast, where the army is battling separatist rebels.
item.dc:creator: By EDWARD WONG

item.title: Recipient of Artificial Heart Is Well Enough to Head Home
item.description: The news, reported by Carmat, the French company that developed the device, signals a milestone toward its possible commercialization.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID JOLLY

item.title: Indonesia’s Execution of Foreigners Prompts Diplomatic Storm
item.description: Brazil and the Netherlands withdrew their ambassadors to Indonesia after a Brazilian and a Dutch citizen convicted of drug offenses were executed.
item.dc:creator: By AUSTIN RAMZY

item.title: Chinese Police Kill 2 Uighurs Fleeing to Vietnam, Reports Say
item.description: The shooting in the Guangxi region occurred when a van carrying five Uighurs refused to stop and members of the group resisted arrest with knives, the state news media reported.
item.category: Ministry of Public Security of the People's Republic of China
item.dc:creator: By CHRIS BUCKLEY

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Saturday Night in Taipei, and the Cool Kids Are at the Bookstore
item.description: At a time when many booksellers are struggling, Eslite is thriving, with 43 stores in Taiwan and one in Hong Kong. One secret to its success in Taiwan: It operates like a self-contained mall.
item.category: Lean In: Women, Work, and the Will to Lead (Book)
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL FORSYTHE
item.media:credit: Sean Marc Lee for The New York Times
item.media:description: The entrance to the Eslite Bookstore on Dunhua South Road in Taipei, which is open 24 hours a day. Eslite owes much of its success to being considerably more than just a bookstore.

item.title: Open Source: Fox News Apologizes for False Claims of Muslim-Only Areas in England and France
item.description: Fox News issued a correction on supposed “no-go zones” in Europe off-limits to non-Muslims after stirring a wave of outrage and derision.
item.dc:creator: By ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: World Briefing: India: 3 People Killed as Villagers Clash
item.description: At least three Muslims were burned to death when their thatched huts were set on fire during a clash between Hindu and Muslim groups in a village in eastern India, a government official said Sunday.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Indonesia: 6 Executed for Drug Offenses
item.description: Indonesia on Sunday brushed aside last-minute appeals by foreign leaders over the weekend and executed by firing squad six people convicted of drug trafficking, including five foreigners.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Nigeria: Raiders Hit Cameroon Villages
item.description: Gunmen suspected of being members of the extremist group Boko Haram in Nigeria kidnapped dozens of people and killed three others on Sunday in a cross-border attack on villages in northern Cameroon, officials in Cameroon said.
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS

item.title: World Briefing: Belgium: Suspect Is Sought From Greece
item.description: Belgian prosecutors are seeking the extradition of a person arrested in Greece over a possible link with a foiled Islamist plot to attack the Belgian police, officials said Sunday.
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS

item.title: World Briefing: Central African Republic: Peacekeepers Arrest a Christian Militia Commander
item.description: A leader of a Christian militia who has been implicated in attacks on civilians throughout the country has been arrested by United Nations peacekeepers, the country’s senior prosecutor said Sunday.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Freedom for Yazidis, After Months of Torment
item.description: Nearly 200 members of the Yazidi religious minority in Iraq might have been released because Islamic State militants could no longer provide food and medicine for them, former captives and Iraqi officials said.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By KAREEM FAHIM
item.media:description: A tearful reunion in Kirkuk, Iraq, for a freed Yazidi held captive by Islamic State militants.

item.title: Hezbollah Says Israeli Helicopter Strike Killed Five Fighters in Syria
item.description: The attack, which Israel did not acknowledge, threatened to rekindle longstanding tensions between Israel and Hezbollah.
item.dc:creator: By ANNE BARNARD and ISABEL KERSHNER
item.media:description: Israeli troops patrolled the Israeli-occupied sector of the Golan Heights on Sunday.

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Human Rights and the 2022 Olympics
item.description: New reforms will get a rigorous test as Kazakhstan and China vie for the title.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By MINKY WORDEN
